title: Am I the only one who wants jungle farming to actually be efficient?
body:
I know that theres an item that rewards you for getting stacks for jungle monster killing, but it's far too slow. I like that in dota 2 that you can either gank or farm the jungle and be useful later. Far more than in LoL. In LoL junglers are basically required to gank to put pressure on lanes. I don't see that's wrong, but I wish we had more options as a jungler. 

What if we had a reward for stealing the enemy jungle camps? Or destroying wards? Or not even touching an enemy champion until a later stage? You can say that destroying wards destroys vision. That's not wrong, but what if we gained a permanent stack? Or extra gold? 

When riot announced they wanted more ways to end a game for season 5, I was excited. In dota 2 you can end a game by just destroying the enemy team in fights, split pushing, controlling the map, pressuring their base all game, everything. In League we have that now, to an extent. I like options, and how they're giving us more. I'd like them to see if they look more to the jungle though. Cinderhulk was an amazing improvement for tank junglers.

Can we look to farm junglers now? Carry junglers? Perhaps maybe one day we'll see ADC's in the jungle, or we'll see tryn, master yi & fiora jungle again. Or ironically, we won't see them until they come out with ALOT of gold. Can always dream?

replies.body: I think their design philosophy beind that is they don't want the jungler just farming PVE monsters unharassed and uncontested, then exploding out of the jungle fat with gold.

I mean, I understand that. I just don't understand why that's so harmful? They're creating more jungle options, why not allow farm junglers a thing? I love variety in anything. There are so many junglers that would benefit from this. It might even open up the jungling pool more. You could even take it further making supports decent junglers. Having a benefit where they jump into lane, giving a jungle item where it works similar to relic shield/targons or if you're a healing support when you heal an ally you get gold based on how many jungle camps you've killed?

> I mean, I understand that. I just don't understand why that's so harmful? They're creating more jungle options, why not allow farm junglers a thing? I love variety in anything. 

It's about counter-play.

The idea of counter-play is that a mechanic/gameplay element in a PvP game should be as engaging to have used on you as it is to use yourself. Generally speaking this is accomplished by giving opponents a few options to deal with a thing (where not playing the game isn't an option considered for this).

The issue with feeling awesome about getting fat in the jungle is it sucks for everybody else in the game and there's nothing you can really do against it. Besides counter-jungling, which is so risky at the moment it's not a counter so much as either voluntarily countering yourself, or something you do when you're really fed to rub salt in the wounds of your opponents.

But good counter junglers such as lee sin, shaco, even nunu, are great at that. They can get in and out fast. 

Shaco has invis, can setup traps, nearly inescapable. Lee sin can ward jump with his trinket out of harm, and if they flash to get him, well you got a flash. Nunu just needs mobility boots and with his w and even if they can catch up to him, he has his snowball to slow them down further. 

Those are just some examples. Counter jungling has been a thing, with risk since the start of the game. In fact I can't think of a moba that has jungling, that doesn't have counter jungling? (If that makes sense? O_o)

Riot wants to support both playstyles.  Purple smite is for making farming faster and keeping you sustained.  White smite is for jacking the opponent's stuff and getting out quickly.  There are design challenges to making both of these playstyles as useful for competitive play as ganking playstyles.

When farming as a strategy is strong, it is riskier to counter it than it is to perform it.  That's always going to limit the upside of the thing.

Counterjungling is risky to start, and has good counterplay mechanics, but it can easily snowball out of control.  That's the main design challenge to enabling counterjungling as a dedicated strategy, rather than an opportunistic thing.

> [{quoted}](name=PubgamerAU,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=akTVMylW,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-03-20T18:32:02.277+0000)
>
> If the jungle becomes equal with lanes in income, you'll see ADC's jungling with a support instead of laning, and just having 3 solo lanes.

And?

And that means zero risk for the ADC's. That's not the kind of philosophy Riot are pushing. Junglers right now have risk involved because the jungle's income is less than a lane. This forces the jungler to go to lanes and gank/push objectives in order to keep up.

If the jungle becomes lane #4, you'll find ganks dry up, ADC's farming safely hidden from view. Riot doesn't want this. Their philosophy is for there to be consistent action throughout the map.

And this is a problem...why again?  I think that'd be pretty neat for ganking. If you have a CC-centric lane, you can send the Marksman to provide the DPS to that lane and have the support gank mid or something.

I get the assumption that's something you wouldn't want, but if you look at LCS, you see something such as a top laner going with a jungler, in order for the top laner to at least get some exp and farm without punishing itself completely, even though both of them are getting less overall. 

Like I said before, I like variety, granted it'd be something we have probably never seen before, I wouldn't be opposed to it. Options options options.

The jungle is significantly lower risk than a lane, therefore it should have less reward.

Think about it; how do you deny a laner farm? You can kill them, zone them from the minions, force them to back, shove the wave into the tower so the tower kills the miniosn, freeze the lane at your tower so they cannot farm without fear of jungle ganks, etc.

How do you deny a jungler farm? You have to kill the jungler or take the farm for yourself. The camps are gonna stay there, alive, not dying, until somebody kills them, in contrast to lane minions which get killed whether or not there's a champion there. Tie this into how dangerous it can be to counterjungle or attempt to kill a jungler in their own jungle (the enemy team can more easily collapse onto you than vice versa) and this means that a jungler can farm the jungle easier than a laner can farm a lane.

If the jungle is equal in income to the lanes, then people can get the same amount of gold for significantly lower risk. This would merely push things to the opposite extreme; the laners would complain about having a less easy source of revenue.

Also, I don't want people to be rewarded by AFK farming the jungle for 30 minutes and coming out a god. This is a PvP game, dammit.

And unlike lane minions, jungle monsters do not respawn at fixed intervals; rather, the timer does not start until the previous batch dies. This means if you are not clearing them as they respawn you are falling behind where you could be. Which is really the same thing as missing minions in lane, since the total amount you can get in a given time frame will be reduced.
